page.title: 20CRAZIES HILL/WARGRAVE SURVEY
page.content: This{Domesday Survey}has been carried out by children aged 8 to 11 in the Junior Class of{Crazies Hill CE {Primary School.} It was an exercise which employed resources previously unavailable to the children. A video camera was borrowed to record interviews which were then assessed, by the children, for inclusion in the text pages.Local people, parents and governors came to school to talk with the children on a greater scale than usual, providing a valuable link with the community. The amenity count and some pages of text were completed with assistance of secondary pupils from{The Piggott {School, Wargrave.}Crazies Hill children, in particular, used the computer for data handling while the Piggott children concentrated on its use as a word processor.
